elements.text: How can I change my mindset to accommodate the speed and multiple dispatch of Julia, and what should I change my mindset to?

text: Multiple dispatch really is a whole different programming paradigm, and I think it took me way too long to really understand that. Just remembering to actually _use_ multiple dispatch was one step (i.e., if I’m writing a package, and there’s a problem that can be solved with dispatch, to find it and actually structure the code that way), and another was being conscious of (and eliminating) type instability.

text:
As far as multiple dispatch as a programming paradigm, it can be interesting to think of “dispatch-oriented” programming as an alternative to class-based object-oriented programming

(emphasis on class-based I suppose, since as people here are fond of pointing out, there is an argument to be made that multiple dispatch is arguably at least as close if not closer to the original intent of OO (e.g. <https://medium.com/javascript-scene/the-forgotten-history-of-oop-88d71b9b2d9f>) than the currently ubiquitous class-based version of OO that leads to things like “`RequestProcessorFactoryFactory`” s )

I didn’t have any (class-based) OO background to begin with, but if you do, and you ever find yourself asking “wouldn’t this be easier if I could use multiple inheritance” for this problem or that, that can be a hint to try rethinking things in a more dispatch-centric way.
